lead_paragraph: SNYDER--Stanford I. "Stan" died of natural causes on February 19, 2016. Survived by wife Bridget Snyder, brother David Snyder, former wife Jerry Steen, daughter Julie Pildner, son Kyle Snyder, and three grandchildren. Predeceased by sister Sue Johnson. Stan's career began in 1964 at Columbia Records leading to VP of Marketing and VP of Sales. He co-founded Cleveland International Records in 1977 releasing Meat Loaf's "Bat Out of Hell." Born in 1938 in Chicago, IL, Stan was raised in Riverside, CT, attending Riverside Elementary and Brunswick schools. Stan proudly served in the United States Marine Corps from 1958 to 1959. He graduated Yale University in 1962 and attended Columbia Business School. He played jazz piano in bands throughout his life. Stan was a natural storyteller who enjoyed lifelong friendships. He was inseparable from his best friend and wife, Bridget, since they met in 1989. Service on March 2, 2016, 1pm at the Riverside Yacht Club, Riverside, CT. Donations to the Wounded Warrior Project. 1/3
